intro: Dactylicapnos macrocapnos subsp. echinosperma, commonly known as the spiny-fruited bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its spiny, globose fruits and hairy stems. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
